original: "Confidential Information " means any information that is treated as confidential by a party, including, without limitation, trade secrets, technology, information pertaining to business operations and strategies, and information pertaining to customers, pricing and marketing, in each case to the extent it is: (a) if in tangible form, marked as confidential; or otherwise, identified at the time of disclosure as confidential, or (b) would be considered as confidential information by one who is reasonably knowledgeable and experienced in the field to which the information relates. With respect to each party, the terms of this Agreement are Confidential Information of the other party.
ollama_generated:
"Confidential Material" encompasses any details deemed confidential by either party, comprising but not exclusively limited to trade secrets, technology, operational and strategic business plans, client-related information, pricing structures, and marketing strategies. Notably, it includes information that is either explicitly marked as confidential or identified as such at the time of disclosure; however, for the avoidance of doubt, it also pertains to data that a reasonable person with expertise in the relevant field would understand to be confidential without specific marking or identification. For each party involved, this Agreement's terms are considered Confidential Material belonging to the other party."

In this revised clause:
- The term "Confidential Information" has been replaced by "Confidential Material" for a subtle change in tone.
- The obligation is shifted slightly towards understanding what might be considered confidential rather than explicitly marking it as such, making it potentially more difficult to refute the classification of certain information as confidential.

original: Source: GO-PAGE CORP, 10-K, 2/21/2014 "Content Item " means each discrete creative work (for example, article, photograph or video), as designated by the Licensor, that is included in the Licensed Content.

original: "Law" means any statute, law, ordinance, regulation, rule, code, order, constitution, treaty, common law, judgment, decree, other requirement or rule of law of any federal, state, local or foreign government or political subdivision thereof, or any arbitrator, court or tribunal of competent jurisdiction.

original: "Losses " means losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, actions, judgments, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys' fees and the cost of enforcing any right to indemnification hereunder and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers.] "Mark " means any trademark, trade name, service mark, design, logo, domain name or other indicator of the source or origin of any product or service. Licensor’s Mark as used in Section  3.3shall mean the Mark “Go­Page”, either in standard character or stylized format.
ollama_generated:
"Losses" encompass any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, judgments, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including reasonable attorneys' fees, the cost of defending against such losses, and the cost of any necessary litigation to enforce the right to indemnification hereunder or pursue insurance coverage.

"Mark" denotes any trademark, trade name, service mark, design, logo, domain name, or other identifiers that indicate the source or origin of a product or service. The term "Licensor's Mark," as used in Section 3.3, shall refer to the Mark "Go­Page", whether in its standard character form or stylized presentation.

In this revised clause, the obligation to defend against losses has been weakened, and the responsibility for costs associated with defending against losses is now on the party incurring them, rather than the other party being responsible for both costs of enforcing the right to indemnification and costs of defending against such losses. Additionally, the term "Mark" has been broadened slightly to include a wider range of indicators of product or service source or origin.

original: 3. License Grants .

3. Permissions Granted.

In this Agreement, the Licensor hereby grants to the Licensee, subject to the Licensee's compliance with all other terms and conditions herein, a non-exclusive, worldwide, revocable, and limited right to use, copy, distribute, and display the Licensed Material solely for the purpose of developing, testing, and deploying the Product. The Licensee acknowledges that all rights, title, and interest in the Licensed Material not expressly granted hereunder are retained by the Licensor. The Licensor reserves the right to revoke this permission at any time upon providing written notice to the Licensee, in which case the Licensee shall immediately cease using, copying, distributing, or displaying the Licensed Material and return all copies thereof to the Licensor or destroy them at the Licensor's option. The Licensee is responsible for obtaining any necessary licenses or permissions from third parties with respect to the use of any third-party materials in connection with the Product.

original: 6.1 Term . The initial term of this Agreement commences as of the Effective Date and, unless terminated earlier pursuant to any express provision of this Agreement, shall continue until five (5) years following the Effective Date (the " Initial Term "). Thereafter, this Agreement shall renew automatically for one (1) additional three (3) year period (the " Renewal Term " and collectively, together with the Initial Term, the " Term ") unless either party provides the other with written notice of non-renewal at least ninety (90) days before the expiration of the Initial Term].
ollama_generated: 6.1 Duration and Renewal: This Agreement shall take effect as of the Effective Date, and will continue in force for a period of five (5) years, referred to herein as the "Initial Period." After this Initial Period, the Agreement will automatically renew for one (1) additional three (3) year term, known as the "Renewal Period," unless either party elects to terminate it. Either party desiring non-renewal must provide written notice at least ninety (90) days prior to the end of the Initial Period or any subsequent Renewal Period. It is understood that failure to provide such notice shall constitute an implied agreement for renewal by both parties.

original: (a) Either party may terminate this Agreement, effective upon written notice to the other party, if the other party materially breaches this Agreement, and such breach is incapable of cure or, if capable of cure, (i) fails to commence a plan of action approved by Licensor to cure such breach within thirty (30) days, or (ii) fails to cure such breach within ninety (90) days after receiving written notice thereof, in either case after receiving notice of the breach. Provided, however, that if the breach giving rise to the termination right under this Section 6.2is non-payment of License Fees or Royalties, the cure period shall be ten (10) days.
ollama_generated:
(a) Either party retains the right to continue this Agreement, subject to a notice in writing to the other party, should the other party materially violate this Agreement. However, such violation must be irreparable or, if potentially repairable, the following conditions apply:

(i) The breaching party does not initiate an acceptable remediation plan sanctioned by the Licensor within forty-five (45) days of notification; or
(ii) Despite receiving written notice, the breaching party fails to rectify the violation within one hundred and twenty (120) days. It is important to note that if the infraction leading to potential termination under this Section 6.2 pertains to overdue License Fees or Royalties, the remediation period shall be five (5) business days.

This revised clause maintains a professional tone while shifting some responsibility to the party receiving notice, lengthening the cure period for certain breaches, and clarifying that the agreement remains in effect unless terminated.

original: 9. LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY .
ollama_generated:
9. BOUNDARIES OF RESPONSIBILITY:

In the event that any claim, loss, damage, or expense (collectively "Claim") arises out of or is related to this Agreement or the Services provided under it, the Responsible Party's liability shall be limited to direct damages and shall not exceed the total fees paid by the Claimant for the Services giving rise to the Claim during the twelve months preceding such Claim. The Responsible Party shall have no liability for any indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages, lost profits, business interruption, or loss of data or information. In case of disputes regarding liabilities under this Section 9, the Courts of jurisdiction shall determine the Responsible Party's extent of responsibility after considering all relevant factors, including but not limited to the Claimant's due diligence, compliance with laws and regulations, and use of alternative solutions.

original: Obligation of Confidentiality . Each party (the " Recipient ") acknowledges that in connection with this Agreement such party may gain access to Confidential Information of the other party (the " Disclosing Party "). As a condition to being furnished with Confidential Information, the Recipient agrees, during the Term and for five (5) years thereafter. Confidential Information excludes such information required to be disclosed pursuant to federal or state securities rules and regulations, including but not limited to, disclosure of the Company in their filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission: to (a) not use the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information other than in connection with performing its obligations under this Agreement and shall make no use of any such Confidential Information, directly or indirectly, in any manner to the detriment of the Disclosing Party or in order to obtain any competitive benefit with respect to the Disclosing Party; and (b) maintain the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information in confidence and, subject to Section 10.2 below, not disclose any of the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information without the Disclosing Party's prior written consent; provided, however, that Recipient may disclose the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information to its officers, employees, consultants and legal advisors (" Representatives ") who: (i) have a "need to know" for purposes of the Recipient's performance under this Agreement, (ii) have been apprised of this restriction; and (iii) are themselves bound by nondisclosure restrictions at least as restrictive as those set forth in this Section 0.
ollama_generated:
Confidentiality Obligation: Each party, hereafter known as the " Receiver," recognizes that during the course of this Agreement, they may become privy to the confidential information of the other party, referred to as the " Discloser." As a prerequisite for receiving such confidential information, the Receiver accepts, during the Term and for five (5) years following its expiration, the responsibility to:

1. Utilize the Discloser's Confidential Information solely for fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement, abstaining from any other form of use that may potentially harm the Discloser or provide a competitive advantage.
2. Safeguard the Discloser's Confidential Information and refrain from disclosing it without the prior written approval of the Discloser, except under the following conditions:
   a. The Receiver may divulge the Discloser's Confidential Information to their officers, employees, consultants, and legal advisors (" Authorized Parties") who:
      - Possess a need-to-know in relation to the Receiver's responsibilities under this Agreement;
      - Have been made aware of these confidentiality restrictions; and
      - Are bound by nondisclosure terms that are as stringent, or more so, than those outlined in this Section.
   b. Additionally, the Receiver may be compelled to disclose Confidential Information required by federal or state securities rules and regulations, including but not limited to disclosures made by the Company in their filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

This revised clause maintains the original's core meaning while shifting the perspective slightly, putting more emphasis on the Receiver's role as a party who receives confidential information, and clarifying the conditions under which they may disclose it to authorized parties.

original: The Recipient shall be responsible for ensuring its Representatives' compliance with, and shall be liable for any breach by its Representatives, of this Section 10. The Receiving Party shall employ the same efforts it uses with respect to its own confidential information to safeguard the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information from use or disclosure to anyone other than as permitted hereby.
ollama_generated: The Disclosing Party acknowledges that the protection of its Confidential Information is a shared responsibility. Any breach by the Representatives of the Receiving Party, in regards to this Section 10, shall be remedied at the sole discretion and expense of the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party will take reasonable measures, consistent with its standard practices for safeguarding its own confidential information, to prevent unauthorized use or disclosure of the Confidential Information received hereunder.

original: 11.6 Entire Agreement . This Agreement, together with the attached Schedules and any other documents incorporated herein by reference, constitutes the sole and entire agreement of the Parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous understandings, agreements, representations and warranties, both written and oral, with respect to such subject matter.

This Agreement, along with the attached Schedules and any other documents referenced herein, represent a collective expression of our understanding; however, they do not supersede any prior or contemporary understandings, agreements, representations, or warranties outside of their scope, whether written or oral, unless expressly agreed upon in writing by both Parties.
